definition[0]: to delay the progress or development of something, or delay someone from finishing something
example[0]: Environmental experts said the move would set back further research.
example[1]: Illness had set me back a couple of weeks.
definition[1]: to cost someone a lot of money
example[2]: This jacket set me back over £1,000.
definition[2]: to delay the progress or development of a plan, project etc
example[3]: The war damaged the country’s infrastructure and set back the pace of economic recovery.
example[4]: The schedule was set back to June while auditors reviewed the company’s financial condition.
definition[3]: if something sets you back a large sum of money, it costs you that much
example[5]: The company rescue will set taxpayers back an estimated $111.5 billion.
